sentences.sContent: When fresh food and water are not available,the camel can feed off its hump.
sentences.sContent_eng: When fresh food and water are not available,the camel can feed off its hump.
sentences.sCn: 在没有新食物和水供应时，骆驼从它的驼峰中获取能量。

sentences.sContent: He grew up in an Aïr village, making the annual camel caravan with his father.
sentences.sContent_eng: He grew up in an Aïr village, making the annual camel caravan with his father.
sentences.sCn: 他在阿伊尔高原的一个村庄长大，每年跟随父亲参加骆驼商队。

synos.tran: [畜牧][脊椎]骆驼；打捞浮筒；工作作风官僚

trans.tranOther: a large desert animal with a long neck and either one or two  hump s (= large raised parts )  on its back
